titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Abortion and Birth Control Committee records SSC.MS.00786
titlestmt.author: Madison White

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-10-18 14:57:21 -0400.

change.item: This record was migrated from InMagic DB Textworks to ArchivesSpace.

did.unittitle: Abortion and Birth Control Committee records
did.abstract: The collection contains the newsletters, newspaper clippings, notes, forms, and correspondence of the Abortion and Birth Control Committee, a pre-Roe v. Wade committee associated with Valley Women's Center.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was gifted by Deborah Dizard in 2016.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Pre-Roe v. Wade committee associated with Valley Women's Center.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: The collection has a container list that is available upon request by contacting specialcollections@smith.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Abortion and Birth Control Committee records, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC-MS-00786, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Mass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newsletters, newspaper clippings, notes, forms, and correspondence

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that they own copyright, Deborah Dizard has assigned the copyright of the Abortion and Birth Control Committee's works to Smith College; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by the Committee, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.
